body: A Free Bank Calendar? Don't Count on It J ust try to get a free 1983 calendar in a New York bank. The wall models that used to hang in everyone's kitchen have grown too expensive in Gotham-size quantities. Chemical Bank, for example, once gave out half a million calendars, but this year it has cut back to 350,000 copies (which disappeared
title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY

body: Ansel Adams, one of the masters of American photography, will be recognized in an award presentation at the third annual Fine Art Photography Exposition, which opens this afternoon at 4:30 in the Roosevelt Hotel, Madison Avenue and 45th Street. The three-day event will provide an overview of art photography from the 19th century to the present,
title: WEEKENDER GUIDE; Friday; BEST IN ART PHOTOGRAPHY

body: AT the turn of the century, Sheepshead Bay was a favored resort of the rich. Most came for its race track, its fine seafood restaurants and the s alubrious sea breezes that blew in from the Atlantic. Lillian Russell, Diamond Jim Brady and Lillie Langtry were among t he famous folk who frequented Sheepshead Bay, and they were often s een strolling
title: IF YOU'RE THINKING OF LIVING IN: SHEEPSHEAD BAY

body: The cooking schools listed on these pages were reviewed by Moira Hodgson and Bryan Miller. Judgments are based on the personality of the teacher and his or her knowledge of the subject, and the quality of the ingredients, kitchen and equipment used. Most of the classes were visited within the last two years. Alliance Fran,caise, 22 East 60th
title: THE GUIDE TO NEW YORK COOKING SCHOOLS: WHERE TO LOOK TO LEARN NEW CUISINES

body: Accessible by subway or bus, 15 miles of city beaches line the shores of four of the boroughs - all except Manhattan. The beaches, maintained by the city, are free, clean and, now that the freeze on hiring municipal employees has been lifted, fully staffed with lifeguards. ''The beaches can be reached by public transportation - that is their
title: NEW YORK CITY BEACHES: FREE AND EASY TO REACH

body: The New York City Health Department yesterday released the list of public beaches approved for swimming for the 1982 summer season. Following is a listing of the approved beaches: Brooklyn: Coney Island from Manhattan Beach to West 37th Street. Bronx: Orchard Beach, all of City Island and the Long Island Sound area from Lucerne Street to Schley
title: CITY LISTS APPROVED BEACHES

body: THIS is a tough year to look for an apartment or a house in New YorkC ity, but it is also a year of opportunity. The availability of r ental apartments remains low - the vacancy rate was 2.l3 percent at t he most recent count - and high mortgage rates are forcing up the c ost of cooperatives, condominiums and houses. But a b orough-byborough survey
title: A HOMESEEKER'S GUIDE TO THE CITY

body: The Menorah Home and Hospital for the Aged and Infirm will open a new $10 million building tomorrow in the Manhattan Beach section of Brooklyn. The new building, which will house 73 residents, has nursing and recreational facilities for an additional 180 elderly people. The home, which was founded in 1912, is situated at 871 Bushwick Avenue, where
title: NEW FACILITY FOR AGED TO OPEN

body: Representative Stephen J. Solarz was in Cleveland the other day delivering a fervent address on the security and survival of Israel. As he drew to a close, Mr. Solarz, who speaks in a manner that is both confident and affable, came to the matter closest to his heart and the real reason he had flown more than 1,000 miles for a two-hour visit. title: SOLARZ PLANS FOR A RACE TO KEEP BROOKLYN SEAT
